body:
$ ./spack install petsc
==> Error: No available compiler version matches 'None' on operating_system sierra
Run 'spack compilers' to see available compiler Options.
~/Src/spack/bin (develop=) 
$ spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- gcc ----------------------------------------------------------
gcc@6.2.0

-- clang --------------------------------------------------------
clang@8.0.0-apple
~/Src/spack/bin (develop=) 
$ spack find
==> 1 installed packages.
-- darwin-None-x86_64 / clang@8.0.0-apple -----------------------
mpich@3.2
~/Src/spack/bin (develop=) 
$ spack compiler find
==> Added 1 new compiler to /Users/barrysmith/.spack/compilers.yaml
    gcc@4.2.1
~/Src/spack/bin (develop=) 

Kind of an annoying error message. No indication of what I should do to resolve the "problem". Note I upgraded the compilers (xcode and gcc) a few days before upgrading the OS so the compilers are correct for the OS.
title: Spack behavior with macOS upgrade
